description.title: Here are a few projects I've worked on recently.

metafame.header: is a blockchain project developed by a backend developer and me.
metafame.content: I was responsible for Staking & NFT page layout, interacting with blockchain smart contracts, and building with <0>Next.js & Ethers.js</0>. And I introduced <0>TypeScript</0> to reduce bugs and maintain costs.<1></1><1></1>We developed staking and NFT character mint, makeover, refresh, and wardrobe systems for our customers. Also, I use <0>Spine</0> to play Openbox, makeover animate, and <0>SketchFab</0> to show 3D NFT characters.

velhalla.header: is my first blockchain project developed with a senior developer. We studied a lot of articles on how to connect with blockchain and set in two weeks.
velhalla.content: I was responsible for Stake & Comic & Metaverse page layout and interacted with blockchain smart contracts. We developed a stake and trading comic NFT system, built with <0>Next.js & Web3.js</0>.<1></1><1></1>It is my first time learning about blockchain, like connecting with an unstable backend API. So that's why we spend a lot of time with UI & UX.

music.header: is a side project that I want to code with Vue 3.
music.content: build with <0>Vue CLI 4 & Vuex & Tailwind CSS</0>, and use <0>Firebase Database</0> to store users & songs data.<1></1><1></1>On this side, project practice, I was more familiar with how to develop with Vue 3. Also, it was an excellent time to try to establish with Firebase.

stores.content: I developed this website at my previous work, working in a hardware store then. And learn <0>Vue & Vuex</0> in my free time.<1></1><1></1>That's why I can develop this website from the point of view of the users. It has a complete CMS to check all products and orders on PC and mobile devices.

emaily.header: is an app that can send email surveys to your users and collect their feedback.
emaily.content: In the front-end, I build with <0>React</0> and <0>Redux</0>.<1></1><1></1>And use <0>Express</0> and <0>MongoDB</0> to build a database server.<1></1>It's a good experience to learn about how AJAX works on a server.

maskmap.header: could find masks close to your house or work
maskmap.content: when people build mask maps in Taiwan. They usually use OSM and Leaflet. But I want to try the original <0>Google Maps API </0> because its UI and API are beautiful and interesting.<1></1><1></1>During this time, I've learned a lot about how to use <0>Google Maps API </0>.
